summary: Chapter 11- A Family to Call Her Own
title: Chapter 11- A Family to Call Her Own
body:
Ok, I know it’s been a long time since I posted chapter 10, but it’s better late than never right?! As always thanks to @lovesmelikebrandnewstarlight for being an angel and helping me out with this chapter and for being wonderful. 

Let me know what you think

Master List 

Chapter 10

It was the middle of summer in London, which admittedly, wasn’t that hot compared to what Poppy grew up with back home, but she’d lived here for four years now and by her  current standards, 25 degrees celsius, was hot, and being pregnant didn’t help. She was glad that she’d finally reached the end of the first trimester, her morning sickness had almost vanished and her energy had started to come back. The last two weeks had been hell, she was tired the second she woke up and she could barely eat anything without throwing it up. Making it through the work day had been rough, but she was grateful she had Ella and Grimmy to cover for her while she took a power nap in her lunch break. She was coming out of it now though and while she wasn’t out of the woods in terms of the high-risk pregnancy, she was glad that she was feeling better.

It was a Friday, and since Poppy had Friday’s off now, she’d spent the day running a few basic errands, stocking up on groceries and ducking into a few high street stores to buy some basic Maternity wear. She had the slightest bump now, still not enough for people to notice when she was wearing loose clothing, but her jeans were getting uncomfortable, and she could always find an excuse to go to TopShop. She still hadn’t told her family, and she was still nervous to admit it in case something happened, but 12 weeks was traditionally when people announced their pregnancies, so that’s why she was sitting on her bed at 9pm, laptop open, waiting for her mum to answer the skype call.

“Well hello there Miss Poppy, I wasn’t expecting a call from you this morning” her mum answered, pointing the camera up towards the ceiling so that Poppy couldn’t see her face, she could tell that it was a nice day from the lighting in the room and she suddenly found herself missing the cold June days spent at home by the fire, the smell of her mums soup filling the air.

“Hi Mum, I can’t see your face if you point the camera up like that” she said giggling, glad to be talking her

“Oh that’s ok, you don’t want to see my face anyway”

“I really do, I haven’t seen you since Christmas, I miss your face”

“Fine, but don’t complain about my chins” she aimed the camera back at her face “So, why have I been honoured with your call this fine Saturday morning?”

“Can’t I just call for a chat?” Poppy stalled, sudden butterflies filling her stomach.

“You can, but you don’t”

“You’re right, I have some news” she sighed “Is Dad there?”

“Yeah, he’s around here somewhere” she turned around looking for her dad “is it good news?”

Poppy smiled widely  “It’s great news Mum”

Her mum turned back around and looked straight at Poppy through the screen “Are you coming home?”

Poppy shook her head “No mum, I’m not coming home, London’s home now”

She let out a big sigh “This will always be your home Poppy”

“I know mum, but you know what I mean” she smiled “Now go find Dad, and Emma too if she’s around”

“She’s at that boys house again, you’ll have to call her later”

“Alright, I can do that, but get Dad now and I’ll tell you”

“Alright alright” she turned around again “John!” she called “Poppy’s on the computer thing, she’s got something to tell us” she turned back to the screen “He’s in his corner, he’s on his way though”

She heard her dad walk into the room where their computer sat “What’d you say love”

Her mum rolled her eyes “Poppy’s on the computer call, she’s got some news”

John’s torso appeared in the screen “Oh hello darling, how are you?”

“I’m great dad, how are you?”

“Oh I’m alright” he sighed “Still haven’t retired, but I’m getting by”

“What did you want to tell us Poppy?” her mum chimed in, obviously eager to hear the news

“Oh, Uh,” Poppy bit her lip, butterflies forming in the pit of her stomach again, her parents were very traditional, and they’d always told her that she needed to be married before she had a baby, and Poppy always thought she would be, but things don’t always go to plan, and she knew that they’d be happy for her eventually, but at first, she wasn’t sure how they’d react.

“Everything ok?” her  Mum asked

“Yeah Mum, everything’s great, I’m” she swallowed the lump in her throat, trying to hold back the tears “I’m pregnant”

“Oh my goodness” her mum brought her hands to her face, covering her mouth and her Dad, stood there in silence “how far along?”

“12 weeks, today” Poppy smiled

Her Dad cleared his throat “Who’s the, uh, who’s the father?”

“Um” Poppy frowned “his name’s Danny, but he doesn’t want anything to do with it”

Both  parents frowned with her for a moment, her mum finally breaking the silence “Poppy, dear, I think you should think about moving back home, you can’t do this by yourself”

Poppy knew her mum would try and convince her to move home, she’d been doing it for the past four years, but she didn’t think she would straight out say she couldn’t do it on her own.

“I’m not really doing it on my own mum”

“What do you mean?” she asked, confused

“I’ve got Harry”

She laughed “And what happens when Harry goes away on tour? And finds a girl that doesn’t already have a baby?”

“Then I’ll still have Harry.” Poppy said bluntly, knowing that Harry was in this with her for the long hall, even if their relationship wasn’t romantic, she knew that he was going to be there for her and her son.

“Where is he now then?”

She didn’t want to admit that he wasn’t in London right now, but she didn’t really have a choice “He’s in L.A. promoting his movie, he’ll be back on Monday”

“So you’ve only got Harry when it’s convenient for Harry” her mum said bluntly, her mouth set in a hard line

“That’s not how it is Mum, there are times when he has to go away for work, but when he’s here, he’s here, he cancelled rehearsals when we thought I was having a miscarriage, he was there when I had to tell Danny, and he came with me to my first doctor’s appointment, he cooks me dinner every night he left meals in my freezer for while he’s away, he’s here mum and not just when it works for him”

She blinked at the screen “You thought you were having a miscarriage?”

“Yeah, two weeks ago, everything’s fine, he’s healthy in there”

“He?” her dad asked

“Yeah Dad, it’s a boy”

She could see the tears forming in her Mum’s eyes “I’m going to have a grandson?”

“Yeah, you are” she smiled, tears forming in her own eyes

“I’m sorry for saying that about Harry, I know he’s a good friend to you, but friendship only goes so far when there’s a baby in the mix”

“I know mum, and I worry about that all the time, but everything’s going to be ok, he’s not going to let me do this alone”

“Oh I know sweetie, you’re going to be a great mum, I just get worried about you being over there by yourself” the tears were rolling down her cheeks now “Oh I wish I could hug you right now”

Poppy giggled through her own tears “I’m not by myself Mum, I’ve got a lot of really great friends here”

“I know you do Poppy” her dad wiped the tears away from her mums face “When are you due?” she asked looking at her husband and thanking him.

“Technically, December 15th, but because of my uterus thing, I have two different C-section dates scheduled”

“Which are?” her dad asked

“November 10th, and December 1st”

“I guess we’re coming to London for Christmas then” her Mum smiled, rubbing her dad’s arm

“I guess you are” she laughed, pleased with how they reacted

“Alright sweetie, go and call your sister, and if you have any questions about anything, just ring me!”

“Thanks Mum, I’ll text you the photos I have from the scans”

“Oh that’ll be lovely” she smiled

“Bye darling” her dad called “we’re very happy for you, and we’re always here for you”

“Thanks dad, I’ll talk to you soon”

Poppy hung up the call and took a deep breath, relieved that they took the news well. Her mum was right in being sceptical about Harry’s role in all this, Poppy, herself were a little sceptical about how it was all going to work, but she knew that he was always going to be there, and that he would love this little prince just as much as she did, and that was enough for her. After giving herself a few minutes to allow her tears to dry, she went out to the kitchen to make herself a cup of tea and call her sister. she sat at her counter and dialled the number, waiting for her to answer

“Poppy! Haven’t heard from you for a while, how’s London?” Emma answered.

“Very British” Poppy laughed

“Never would have guessed” she said sarcastically

“So, Mum tells me you’re at a boy’s house” Poppy questioned. Anna was 20 now, she had her own life and her own things going on, but Poppy would always see her as the 16-year-old she was when she moved to London.

“It’s just Matt, he’s my Harry, but like, less famous”

Poppy smiled at the thought of her having someone as supportive as Harry “That’s great Em, how’s uni going?”

“It’s great, I’m really enjoying it” she said cheerfully “hey, isn’t it Friday night there, shouldn’t you be out doing fun things with your cool friends and not calling your little sister”

Poppy giggled “My friends aren’t that cool, they’re all at home alone too, I called because I have some news”

“Are you coming home?!”

“No, and you’ve been spending too much time with Mum”

“Yeah, I know” she sighed into the mouthpiece “Anyway, what’s your news”

“I’m having a baby Emma”

“Oh my god!” she screamed into the phone and Poppy held it away from her ear “is it Harry’s?”

“Ummm No” she said confused, thinking about what she just said about Matt “You know how babies happen right?”

“You gotta do the sex usually” she said matter-of-factly

“Yeah, I’ve literally never done that with Harry”

“Oh” she sounded taken aback “So you two aren’t friends with benefits?”

“Nooooo” she said, lowering the tone of her voice “does that mean that you and Matt are friends with benefits?”

“Yep” she was starting to sound a little awkward

“Ok, well like, use protection, don’t make the same mistake I did”

“So who is the Dad?”

“Some dude named Danny, apparently his sperm has more stamina than he does”

“Ok gross, I don’t need the details”

“Yeah ok sorry, you really don’t” Poppy cleared her throat “anyway, you’re going to be an aunt in a few months”

“When is it due?”

“He’s due in December,” she emphasized the ‘he’ as an easy way to tell her the sex, “but he’ll probably be early”

“it’s a he?”

“It’s a boy” Poppy smiled even though she knew that Emma couldn’t see her

“Oh my god, is Kiwi about you?” Poppy was surprised by the sudden change of topic “Is that why he posted that photo on Instagram?”

“Um no, that song was written like more than a year ago, I’m a little offended that you think it’s about me to be honest”

“Sorry, I had to ask” she laughed “Congratulations Poppy, this is the most adult thing you’ve ever done”

“I know, it’s terrifying”

***

July 4th 2017 – 12 weeks

Poppy was sitting at her desk, staring out her window at the beautiful blue that was blessing the London sky, wishing she was outside enjoying the pleasant weather, instead of being cooped up inside trying desperately to find a heart rate monitor for some ridiculous game Nick wanted to play with Harry next week. So far, she’d contacted three hospitals, and all of them flat out refused to rent out a heart rate monitor to a radio station, which Poppy thought was reasonable, but it was still her job to find someone that would.

Ella was working away happily at her desk, answering calls and taking messages for different members of staff when Poppy heard her say Harry’s name.

“Harry Styles is here?” she said, curiously into the phone, turning around to look at her. He arrived back from L.A. late last night and went straight back to his house, so he wouldn’t wake Poppy up, but that meant that it had almost been a week since she’d seen him. Poppy shrugged her shoulders at Ella, not knowing why he was here either.

“He’s not scheduled to be in until next week, but let him anyway, I’m sure he won’t cause too much trouble” Poppy’s stomach dropped at the thought of seeing him after having that conversation with her mum the other day. Ella winked at her and put the phone down “Did you know he was coming?”

“I had no idea, I haven’t spoken to him since he got home from L.A”

“Trouble in paradise?” she asked, a tone of menace in her voice

Poppy picked up the pad of post-it-notes that were sitting next to her laptop and playfully threw them at her “Shut up El, there’s nothing going on between us”

The elevator doors opened on the other side of the room and Harry walked out, wearing a hoodie and his paperboy hat, carrying what looked like a gift bag and a tray of coffee’s.

“Mr Styles” Ella said, very professionally

Harry furrowed his brow at her formal introduction, which was out of character for her, “Yeah hey Ella” he handed her a coffee from the tray “Mocha, right?”

“Oooh thank you” she said taking the cup off him “you should visit more often”

“I’ll think about it” he said as he made his way over to Poppy’s desk, placing the gift bag and another cup of coffee in front of her “Hey baby Mumma”

“Hiya” she said, looking at the cup in front of her, feeling the butterflies rise in her stomach as he smiled at her

“It’s tea” he said reassuringly

“Great” she took a sip “how was your flight home?”

“It was alright” he nodded, pushing the gift bag closer to her “Got you a little something in L.A” Poppy frowned at him, pulling the bag closer to her “Don’t give me that face love, it’s not really for you, it’s for the little man”

The frown disappeared from her face as she looked inside the bag to see a flat white box with a ‘Gucci’ logo embossed in the middle “Harry!” she exclaimed, pulling it out of the bag as he smirked, pulling a chair over from the reception area

“What?!” he asked innocently

“It’s Gucci” she untied the ribbon that held the box shut and pulled the lid off, revealing a navy blue baby grow, covered in yellow teddy bears

“D’you like it?”

“I love it H” she said, touching the fabric “It’s so soft”

“It’s 100% wool, and I figured since he’s a winter baby, that it will come in handy”

“It’s great, thank you H” she stood from her chair and opened her arms to hug him “Kid’s not even born yet and he already owns more designer clothes than I do”

“And who’s fault is that?”

Herr mouth twitched into a smirk “Mine”

“Hmm, exactly” he smiled “12 weeks, how does it feel?”

“I haven’t puked in 3 days, it’s wonderful” she laughed, pulling her shirt tight over her belly “Look, I’ve even got a bump”

His eyes widened, and he reached his arm out, stopping just before he touched her “may I?” Poppy nodded, grabbing his hand and placing it over the bump, enjoying the intimacy of the act.  

“That’s your God Son”

His smiled widened and his eyes sparkled with excitement “He’s really in there”

“Oh would you two get a room” Ella called from her desk, watching as Harry removed his hand from her belly and sat back down in the chair he’d taken over to her desk.

“Shut up Ella” Poppy laughed “Get some work done”

“I could say the same to you” she tutted

“Ooh, actually on that note” she pulled a calendar out from her desk draw, “H, when can you come in for your live lounge?”

“Uhhh” he pulled his phone out from his pocket and checked his calendar “Any time in the first three weeks of August”

“How about the 19th?” she said looking at the schedule

“I’m sure that’s fine, but leave it with me and I’ll let you know for sure in a few days”

“Great” she said taking a pencil out from her tin and wrote his name on the 19th with a question mark next to it “See Ella, we’re working” she rolled her eyes and turned back to her desk, opening her own laptop to get some work done.

Poppy noticed the last cup of coffee in the tray that Harry had brought in with him “who’s that for H?”

“Grimmer’s if he’s still in”

“He is” Poppy stood from her chair “let’s go find him, I need to talk to him anyway”

Harry followed her down the hallway to Grimmy’s studio, where he was busy doing some production work. She knocked on the door and opened it as nick took his head phones off and placed them on the desk

“Hiya” he said, a wide smile on his face “Ready for lunch, are we?”

“I could go for some lunch” Harry said, walking in behind her

“Styles!” Nick exclaimed, not expecting to see Harry today, “What are ya doing here?”

“He wants more radio play” she winked and Harry handed grimmy the cup of coffee “so you know that thing you wanted me to get for your interview with this guy next week?” Poppy pointed at Harry

“Yeah”

“I don’t know if it’s going to happen, but I haven’t given up yet”

“Don’t be going to any extra trouble for me, and don’t get yourself stressed”

“Yes H” she rolled her eyes, secretly enjoying how much he cared for her, “Now, Mumma’s hungry, let’s get some food”

Grimmy stood up from his chair, “Alright, let’s go then, before you kill us both”

“Let’s just get something delivered, I’ve got work to do”

“Alright alright” she turned around again “John!” she called “Poppy’s on the computer thing, she’s got something to tell us” she turned back to the screen “He’s in his corner, he’s on his way though”

She heard her dad walk into the room where their computer sat “What’d you say love”

Her mum rolled her eyes “Poppy’s on the computer call, she’s got some news”

John’s torso appeared in the screen “Oh hello darling, how are you?”

“I’m great dad, how are you?”

“Oh I’m alright” he sighed “Still haven’t retired, but I’m getting by”

“What did you want to tell us Poppy?” her mum chimed in, obviously eager to hear the news

“Oh, Uh,” Poppy bit her lip, butterflies forming in the pit of her stomach again, her parents were very traditional, and they’d always told her that she needed to be married before she had a baby, and Poppy always thought she would be, but things don’t always go to plan, and she knew that they’d be happy for her eventually, but at first, she wasn’t sure how they’d react.

“Everything ok?” her  Mum asked

“Yeah Mum, everything’s great, I’m” she swallowed the lump in her throat, trying to hold back the tears “I’m pregnant”

“Oh my goodness” her mum brought her hands to her face, covering her mouth and her Dad, stood there in silence “how far along?”

“12 weeks, today” Poppy smiled

Her Dad cleared his throat “Who’s the, uh, who’s the father?”

“Um” Poppy frowned “his name’s Danny, but he doesn’t want anything to do with it”

Both  parents frowned with her for a moment, her mum finally breaking the silence “Poppy, dear, I think you should think about moving back home, you can’t do this by yourself”

Poppy knew her mum would try and convince her to move home, she’d been doing it for the past four years, but she didn’t think she would straight out say she couldn’t do it on her own.

“I’m not really doing it on my own mum”

“What do you mean?” she asked, confused

“I’ve got Harry”

She laughed “And what happens when Harry goes away on tour? And finds a girl that doesn’t already have a baby?”

“Then I’ll still have Harry.” Poppy said bluntly, knowing that Harry was in this with her for the long hall, even if their relationship wasn’t romantic, she knew that he was going to be there for her and her son.

“Where is he now then?”

She didn’t want to admit that he wasn’t in London right now, but she didn’t really have a choice “He’s in L.A. promoting his movie, he’ll be back on Monday”

“So you’ve only got Harry when it’s convenient for Harry” her mum said bluntly, her mouth set in a hard line

“That’s not how it is Mum, there are times when he has to go away for work, but when he’s here, he’s here, he cancelled rehearsals when we thought I was having a miscarriage, he was there when I had to tell Danny, and he came with me to my first doctor’s appointment, he cooks me dinner every night he left meals in my freezer for while he’s away, he’s here mum and not just when it works for him”

She blinked at the screen “You thought you were having a miscarriage?”

“Yeah, two weeks ago, everything’s fine, he’s healthy in there”

“He?” her dad asked

“Yeah Dad, it’s a boy”

She could see the tears forming in her Mum’s eyes “I’m going to have a grandson?”

“Yeah, you are” she smiled, tears forming in her own eyes

“I’m sorry for saying that about Harry, I know he’s a good friend to you, but friendship only goes so far when there’s a baby in the mix”

“I know mum, and I worry about that all the time, but everything’s going to be ok, he’s not going to let me do this alone”

“Oh I know sweetie, you’re going to be a great mum, I just get worried about you being over there by yourself” the tears were rolling down her cheeks now “Oh I wish I could hug you right now”

Poppy giggled through her own tears “I’m not by myself Mum, I’ve got a lot of really great friends here”

“I know you do Poppy” her dad wiped the tears away from her mums face “When are you due?” she asked looking at her husband and thanking him.

“Technically, December 15th, but because of my uterus thing, I have two different C-section dates scheduled”

“Which are?” her dad asked

“November 10th, and December 1st”

“I guess we’re coming to London for Christmas then” her Mum smiled, rubbing her dad’s arm

“I guess you are” she laughed, pleased with how they reacted

“Alright sweetie, go and call your sister, and if you have any questions about anything, just ring me!”

“Thanks Mum, I’ll text you the photos I have from the scans”

“Oh that’ll be lovely” she smiled

“Bye darling” her dad called “we’re very happy for you, and we’re always here for you”

“Thanks dad, I’ll talk to you soon”

Poppy hung up the call and took a deep breath, relieved that they took the news well. Her mum was right in being sceptical about Harry’s role in all this, Poppy, herself were a little sceptical about how it was all going to work, but she knew that he was always going to be there, and that he would love this little prince just as much as she did, and that was enough for her. After giving herself a few minutes to allow her tears to dry, she went out to the kitchen to make herself a cup of tea and call her sister. she sat at her counter and dialled the number, waiting for her to answer

“Poppy! Haven’t heard from you for a while, how’s London?” Emma answered.

“Very British” Poppy laughed

“Never would have guessed” she said sarcastically

“So, Mum tells me you’re at a boy’s house” Poppy questioned. Anna was 20 now, she had her own life and her own things going on, but Poppy would always see her as the 16-year-old she was when she moved to London.

“It’s just Matt, he’s my Harry, but like, less famous”

Poppy smiled at the thought of her having someone as supportive as Harry “That’s great Em, how’s uni going?”

“It’s great, I’m really enjoying it” she said cheerfully “hey, isn’t it Friday night there, shouldn’t you be out doing fun things with your cool friends and not calling your little sister”

Poppy giggled “My friends aren’t that cool, they’re all at home alone too, I called because I have some news”

“Are you coming home?!”

“No, and you’ve been spending too much time with Mum”

“Yeah, I know” she sighed into the mouthpiece “Anyway, what’s your news”

“I’m having a baby Emma”

“Oh my god!” she screamed into the phone and Poppy held it away from her ear “is it Harry’s?”

“Ummm No” she said confused, thinking about what she just said about Matt “You know how babies happen right?”

“You gotta do the sex usually” she said matter-of-factly

“Yeah, I’ve literally never done that with Harry”

“Oh” she sounded taken aback “So you two aren’t friends with benefits?”

“Nooooo” she said, lowering the tone of her voice “does that mean that you and Matt are friends with benefits?”

“Yep” she was starting to sound a little awkward

“Ok, well like, use protection, don’t make the same mistake I did”

“So who is the Dad?”

“Some dude named Danny, apparently his sperm has more stamina than he does”

“Ok gross, I don’t need the details”

“Yeah ok sorry, you really don’t” Poppy cleared her throat “anyway, you’re going to be an aunt in a few months”

“When is it due?”

“He’s due in December,” she emphasized the ‘he’ as an easy way to tell her the sex, “but he’ll probably be early”

“it’s a he?”

“It’s a boy” Poppy smiled even though she knew that Emma couldn’t see her

“Oh my god, is Kiwi about you?” Poppy was surprised by the sudden change of topic “Is that why he posted that photo on Instagram?”

“Um no, that song was written like more than a year ago, I’m a little offended that you think it’s about me to be honest”

“Sorry, I had to ask” she laughed “Congratulations Poppy, this is the most adult thing you’ve ever done”

“I know, it’s terrifying”

***

July 4th 2017 – 12 weeks

Poppy was sitting at her desk, staring out her window at the beautiful blue that was blessing the London sky, wishing she was outside enjoying the pleasant weather, instead of being cooped up inside trying desperately to find a heart rate monitor for some ridiculous game Nick wanted to play with Harry next week. So far, she’d contacted three hospitals, and all of them flat out refused to rent out a heart rate monitor to a radio station, which Poppy thought was reasonable, but it was still her job to find someone that would.

Ella was working away happily at her desk, answering calls and taking messages for different members of staff when Poppy heard her say Harry’s name.

“Harry Styles is here?” she said, curiously into the phone, turning around to look at her. He arrived back from L.A. late last night and went straight back to his house, so he wouldn’t wake Poppy up, but that meant that it had almost been a week since she’d seen him. Poppy shrugged her shoulders at Ella, not knowing why he was here either.

“He’s not scheduled to be in until next week, but let him anyway, I’m sure he won’t cause too much trouble” Poppy’s stomach dropped at the thought of seeing him after having that conversation with her mum the other day. Ella winked at her and put the phone down “Did you know he was coming?”

“I had no idea, I haven’t spoken to him since he got home from L.A”

“Trouble in paradise?” she asked, a tone of menace in her voice

Poppy picked up the pad of post-it-notes that were sitting next to her laptop and playfully threw them at her “Shut up El, there’s nothing going on between us”

The elevator doors opened on the other side of the room and Harry walked out, wearing a hoodie and his paperboy hat, carrying what looked like a gift bag and a tray of coffee’s.

“Mr Styles” Ella said, very professionally

Harry furrowed his brow at her formal introduction, which was out of character for her, “Yeah hey Ella” he handed her a coffee from the tray “Mocha, right?”

“Oooh thank you” she said taking the cup off him “you should visit more often”

“I’ll think about it” he said as he made his way over to Poppy’s desk, placing the gift bag and another cup of coffee in front of her “Hey baby Mumma”

“Hiya” she said, looking at the cup in front of her, feeling the butterflies rise in her stomach as he smiled at her

“It’s tea” he said reassuringly

“Great” she took a sip “how was your flight home?”

“It was alright” he nodded, pushing the gift bag closer to her “Got you a little something in L.A” Poppy frowned at him, pulling the bag closer to her “Don’t give me that face love, it’s not really for you, it’s for the little man”

The frown disappeared from her face as she looked inside the bag to see a flat white box with a ‘Gucci’ logo embossed in the middle “Harry!” she exclaimed, pulling it out of the bag as he smirked, pulling a chair over from the reception area

“What?!” he asked innocently

“It’s Gucci” she untied the ribbon that held the box shut and pulled the lid off, revealing a navy blue baby grow, covered in yellow teddy bears

“D’you like it?”

“I love it H” she said, touching the fabric “It’s so soft”

“It’s 100% wool, and I figured since he’s a winter baby, that it will come in handy”

“It’s great, thank you H” she stood from her chair and opened her arms to hug him “Kid’s not even born yet and he already owns more designer clothes than I do”

“And who’s fault is that?”

Herr mouth twitched into a smirk “Mine”

“Hmm, exactly” he smiled “12 weeks, how does it feel?”

“I haven’t puked in 3 days, it’s wonderful” she laughed, pulling her shirt tight over her belly “Look, I’ve even got a bump”

His eyes widened, and he reached his arm out, stopping just before he touched her “may I?” Poppy nodded, grabbing his hand and placing it over the bump, enjoying the intimacy of the act.  

“That’s your God Son”

His smiled widened and his eyes sparkled with excitement “He’s really in there”

“Oh would you two get a room” Ella called from her desk, watching as Harry removed his hand from her belly and sat back down in the chair he’d taken over to her desk.

“Shut up Ella” Poppy laughed “Get some work done”

“I could say the same to you” she tutted

“Ooh, actually on that note” she pulled a calendar out from her desk draw, “H, when can you come in for your live lounge?”

“Uhhh” he pulled his phone out from his pocket and checked his calendar “Any time in the first three weeks of August”

“How about the 19th?” she said looking at the schedule

“I’m sure that’s fine, but leave it with me and I’ll let you know for sure in a few days”

“Great” she said taking a pencil out from her tin and wrote his name on the 19th with a question mark next to it “See Ella, we’re working” she rolled her eyes and turned back to her desk, opening her own laptop to get some work done.

Poppy noticed the last cup of coffee in the tray that Harry had brought in with him “who’s that for H?”

“Grimmer’s if he’s still in”

“He is” Poppy stood from her chair “let’s go find him, I need to talk to him anyway”

Harry followed her down the hallway to Grimmy’s studio, where he was busy doing some production work. She knocked on the door and opened it as nick took his head phones off and placed them on the desk

“Hiya” he said, a wide smile on his face “Ready for lunch, are we?”

“I could go for some lunch” Harry said, walking in behind her

“Styles!” Nick exclaimed, not expecting to see Harry today, “What are ya doing here?”

“He wants more radio play” she winked and Harry handed grimmy the cup of coffee “so you know that thing you wanted me to get for your interview with this guy next week?” Poppy pointed at Harry

“Yeah”

“I don’t know if it’s going to happen, but I haven’t given up yet”

“Don’t be going to any extra trouble for me, and don’t get yourself stressed”

“Yes H” she rolled her eyes, secretly enjoying how much he cared for her, “Now, Mumma’s hungry, let’s get some food”

Grimmy stood up from his chair, “Alright, let’s go then, before you kill us both”

“Let’s just get something delivered, I’ve got work to do”
trail.content_abstract:
Ok, I know it’s been a long time since I posted chapter 10, but it’s better late than never right?! As always thanks to @lovesmelikebrandnewstarlight for being an angel and helping me out with this chapter and for being wonderful. 

Let me know what you think

Master List 

Chapter 10

It was the middle of summer in London, which admittedly, wasn’t that hot compared to what Poppy grew up with back home, but she’d lived here for four years now and by her  current standards, 25 degrees celsius, was hot, and being pregnant didn’t help. She was glad that she’d finally reached the end of the first trimester, her morning sickness had almost vanished and her energy had started to come back. The last two weeks had been hell, she was tired the second she woke up and she could barely eat anything without throwing it up. Making it through the work day had been rough, but she was grateful she had Ella and Grimmy to cover for her while she took a power nap in her lunch break. She was coming out of it now though and while she wasn’t out of the woods in terms of the high-risk pregnancy, she was glad that she was feeling better.

It was a Friday, and since Poppy had Friday’s off now, she’d spent the day running a few basic errands, stocking up on groceries and ducking into a few high street stores to buy some basic Maternity wear. She had the slightest bump now, still not enough for people to notice when she was wearing loose clothing, but her jeans were getting uncomfortable, and she could always find an excuse to go to TopShop. She still hadn’t told her family, and she was still nervous to admit it in case something happened, but 12 weeks was traditionally when people announced their pregnancies, so that’s why she was sitting on her bed at 9pm, laptop open, waiting for her mum to answer the skype call.

“Well hello there Miss Poppy, I wasn’t expecting a call from you this morning” her mum answered, pointing the camera up towards the ceiling so that Poppy couldn’t see her face, she could tell that it was a nice day from the lighting in the room and she suddenly found herself missing the cold June days spent at home by the fire, the smell of her mums soup filling the air.

“Hi Mum, I can’t see your face if you point the camera up like that” she said giggling, glad to be talking her

“Oh that’s ok, you don’t want to see my face anyway”

“I really do, I haven’t seen you since Christmas, I miss your face”

“Fine, but don’t complain about my chins” she aimed the camera back at her face “So, why have I been honoured with your call this fine Saturday morning?”

“Can’t I just call for a chat?” Poppy stalled, sudden butterflies filling her stomach.

“You can, but you don’t”

“You’re right, I have some news” she sighed “Is Dad there?”

“Yeah, he’s around here somewhere” she turned around looking for her dad “is it good news?”

Poppy smiled widely  “It’s great news Mum”

summary: a little angst here but what ab h and his girl slowly trying to fix their relationship after he cheats on her. she’s literally...
question: a little angst here but what ab h and his girl slowly trying to fix their relationship after he cheats on her. she’s literally broken and has been cheated on in the past and he did the one thing that he promised he wouldn’t. she can’t be intimate with him cause he touched this other girl and he’s really guilty sjsks
answer:
It had bee over five months, maybe even more. But, Y/N didn’t care. For some reason time had become a blur to her. She didn’t know what she was doing, what was happening. She hated herself for still being stuck to something that happened so long ago, or maybe it happened just yesterday, at least it felt like it.

    These past few months, Y/N felt like she wasn’t human anymore. After Y/N had found out about the other girl, she thought of leaving, she really did. She really didn’t want to give anyone, especially her little sister the idea that it was okay if someone treated her like that. But, she couldn’t bring herself to do it. Y/N loved him. And, he loved her, at least that what he told her.

    I love you.

    Y/N and Harry had always been the lovey-dovey couple. They couldn’t keep their hands off of each other. Even when they weren’t officially public, there wasn’t one picture of them walking in the London streets without their hands entangled. Y/N loved it though. It made her feel special. And after they had finally said ‘I love you’ to each other, it had become like a mantra between them They hadn’t gone one single day in their  two years relationship without saying those words. Even when he went on tour they always texted to remind each other. But, one day it had stopped coming from him And that was the first thing that made Y/N realized maybe something was wrong, but never in hundred years she thought he’d be unfaithful to her. At first she thought, he had forgotten and she brushed it off without even thinking about it. But, soon it wasn’t just the ‘I love you’s that changed, their kisses, their touch, their love everything changed with time. And finally after she had confronted him, to her relief he hadn’t lied. He accepted what he had done and later cried for her to stay and claimed to love her. And she still did too, so she stayed. However, nothing was like they used to be. They held hands, they kissed, they said ‘I love you’s to each other but nothing felt same. It was just like the time Harry was cheating on her. But this time Harry wasn’t the reason, this time Y/N was.

    One thing, that made Y/N still have a little respect for him was the fact that he had never touched her during those three months. It was killing her then, though. She thought he wasn’t attracted to her anymore. She had somehow convinced herself she had gained weight and literally starved herself for him. She felt pathetic to think about it now. Harry hadn’t touched her because he felt guilty, he felt as if he was taking advantage of her. There were many times in those three months  Y/N had tried to make him do it, and he’d give in at first but after just few minutes, he’d just leave her or go to sleep saying he didn’t feel good. It hurt her a lot that time, but now it was one of the reason she was still with him.

    It had been a while since she had been intimate with him. She couldn’t even remember the last time, they had done it. Maybe it was the night before he had left for the tour. And it had been eight months since then.

    Harry too missed the intimate moments they used to share. Yes, he did cheat on her but that was the biggest regret of his life. He still couldn’t remember why he had done it, he could only remember one night he had gotten too drunk and the next day he woke up next to Caroline, a German model. And it would’ve been fine then, maybe he would’ve been able to blame it on the drinks maybe, and he wouldn’t have hurt Y/N so bad. But, he had done it again and again and at one point it became a habit of his. But, even then Caroline could never make up for what Y/N had made him feel.

    “Hey, baby how was your day?” Harry spoke the moment he saw Y/N enter their house.

    “It was good,” Y/N replied, but the way she spoke, it reveled something completely different.

    “You look tired,” he told her.

    “I’m fine,” she replied curtly.

    From the day she had confronted him, she was nothing but cold. Harry, didn’t blame her though, he had cheated on her, for crying out loud. She could be as cold and hateful she wanted to be, he just wanted to be forgiven and get back the thing they had. But, Harry didn’t if that wish of his would ever come too.

    “Okay, uh freshen up I’ll serve the dinner,” Harry forced a smile on his face.

    “I think I’ll skip tonight,” Y/N replied and went upstairs without even looking back at him. It hurt Harry, he was not going to lie, it hurt a lot but he couldn’t blame anyone other than himself. And this made him realize just how much he must have hurt her.

    Harry had done this a lot in those three months of their relationship. He’d work ‘til late at night and when he got to get out sooner he’d hit the bar before going to Caroline.

    At least she wasn’t going to bar and spending the night with some random guy.

   Just the idea of her with someone else made his heart clench.

    And he was spending the night with someone. Harry truly didn’t regret something more than this.

    Harry didn’t eat that night. He packed the food in a box and shoved it into the fridge before heading upstairs. Y/n was already in her pj’s and her wet hair tied up in a bun. Harry had lost count just how many times he told her it wasn’t healthy for her hair or her to tie her wet hair like that, but that night Harry decided to not comment on it.

    Y/N decided to ignore him and just got under the blanket and turned her back towards the spot Harry usually slept.

    Harry hated it. Harry hated himself.

    Y/N wasn’t her anymore. She wasn’t her around him or anyone. She used to be so happy and cheerful almost all the time. He even had a yellow heart next her nickname in his phone, because he felt the yellow color defined her better- bright, happy and cheerful. She didn’t like the color much though. She didn’t like any vibrant color much. Most of her closet comprised of black, grey and

light pink.  But, now he could easily define her with color grey, and he hated that.

    Harry slowly went to their bathroom, did his night routine before going to the bed. She was still

laying the way he had left her.

    Harry was getting used to this, though. Almost every night was like this, however the other

nights she’d actually have dinner with him and talk a little. At first they’d

even cuddle at night, but it was as if Y/N was slowly drifting apart.

    “I know you aren’t sleeping,” Harry said finally. He had his back rested on the headboard and eyes fixed at her back.

    ‘Well, I am trying to sleep,” she finally said.

    “It’s nine, babe. You never sleep this early.”

    Y/N didn’t reply this time. Harry almost thought it was the end of the conversation but then Y/N

stirred a little before sitting up and resting her back on the headboard just

like Harry.

     “Harry, I don’t think I can do this anymore,” she said slowly, still not looking at Harry.

    “Baby, why not?”

he took her hand in his. “I promise, I won’t ever do that again. She meant nothing. I love you, please we’ll make this

work.” Harry’s voice was soft but it was so desperate.

    “I just can’t,” Y/N took her hand away from him. “Every time I look at you I remember you’ve

been with her when I was waiting here for you. You cheated on me. It’s just not

fair.”

    She finally looked at him, reveling the watery eyes. Harry honestly didn’t know what to do.

But, he was scared, he was so fucking scared that she’d finally leave him.

    In one swift motion he threw his arms around her and pulled her as close as he could. He was scared.

    “I know, but please Y/N we can make this work, just- we can make this work,” he was crying then. “I love you and we

will get through this. I know I messed up but I promise it won’t happen ever

again.”

    Y/N didn’t say anything for a while, but Harry could hear the soft cries she was letting out.

    It broke his heart. He never wanted to be the reason of her tears but he knew, he hurt her

in one of the worst way possible.

    “Ple-“

    Before, Harry could start again, Y/N spoke. “Make love to me.”

    It took Harry a little by surprise. He let of go her a little and looked at her.

    “Make love to me,Harry,” she told him again.

    This time Harry didn’t waste any time and crashed his lips on hers. Their lips molded into each

other’s, and finally after so long Harry felt the burning passion they once

had. It was as strong as it used to be but it was definitely there and Harry

had never been this thankful.

    That night, they had taken it slow, but the passion and love they had, grew equally fast.

    “I love you,”

Harry had let out the moment he came. He was crying then and so was Y/N, but

for some reason this time he was happy. He didn’t know why but those tears- it just felt right.

    Harry kissed her one last time and rolled over on his side, but he didn’t pull himself out, it just

felt right.

    Y/N didn’t say anything though, but she was smiling through her tears. But, it wasn’t just the

smile that told him that everything will be alright, it was the feeling. It was

as if there was a bubble around them, keeping them away from all the wrongs in

the world, all the wrongs in the past. If Harry could, he’d stay like that

forever, with her so close and everything just right. He kissed her again, this

time Harry was smiling too. Harry didn’t know how long they stayed like that,

looking at each other and smiling bright while their eyes twinkled like the

very first time they met when they were in kindergarten. However, Y/N hadn’t yet

replied, there was no confirmation. But, it was as if she read his mind and

finally told him.

     “I love you too.”

    It had been a while since she had been intimate with him. She couldn’t even remember the last time, they had done it. Maybe it was the night before he had left for the tour. And it had been eight months since then.

    Harry too missed the intimate moments they used to share. Yes, he did cheat on her but that was the biggest regret of his life. He still couldn’t remember why he had done it, he could only remember one night he had gotten too drunk and the next day he woke up next to Caroline, a German model. And it would’ve been fine then, maybe he would’ve been able to blame it on the drinks maybe, and he wouldn’t have hurt Y/N so bad. But, he had done it again and again and at one point it became a habit of his. But, even then Caroline could never make up for what Y/N had made him feel.

    “Hey, baby how was your day?” Harry spoke the moment he saw Y/N enter their house.

    “It was good,” Y/N replied, but the way she spoke, it reveled something completely different.

    “You look tired,” he told her.

    “I’m fine,” she replied curtly.

    From the day she had confronted him, she was nothing but cold. Harry, didn’t blame her though, he had cheated on her, for crying out loud. She could be as cold and hateful she wanted to be, he just wanted to be forgiven and get back the thing they had. But, Harry didn’t if that wish of his would ever come too.

    “Okay, uh freshen up I’ll serve the dinner,” Harry forced a smile on his face.

    “I think I’ll skip tonight,” Y/N replied and went upstairs without even looking back at him. It hurt Harry, he was not going to lie, it hurt a lot but he couldn’t blame anyone other than himself. And this made him realize just how much he must have hurt her.

    Harry had done this a lot in those three months of their relationship. He’d work ‘til late at night and when he got to get out sooner he’d hit the bar before going to Caroline.

    At least she wasn’t going to bar and spending the night with some random guy.

   Just the idea of her with someone else made his heart clench.

    And he was spending the night with someone. Harry truly didn’t regret something more than this.

    Harry didn’t eat that night. He packed the food in a box and shoved it into the fridge before heading upstairs. Y/n was already in her pj’s and her wet hair tied up in a bun. Harry had lost count just how many times he told her it wasn’t healthy for her hair or her to tie her wet hair like that, but that night Harry decided to not comment on it.

    Y/N decided to ignore him and just got under the blanket and turned her back towards the spot Harry usually slept.

    Harry hated it. Harry hated himself.

    Y/N wasn’t her anymore. She wasn’t her around him or anyone. She used to be so happy and cheerful almost all the time. He even had a yellow heart next her nickname in his phone, because he felt the yellow color defined her better- bright, happy and cheerful. She didn’t like the color much though. She didn’t like any vibrant color much. Most of her closet comprised of black, grey and

light pink.  But, now he could easily define her with color grey, and he hated that.

    Harry slowly went to their bathroom, did his night routine before going to the bed. She was still

laying the way he had left her.

    Harry was getting used to this, though. Almost every night was like this, however the other

nights she’d actually have dinner with him and talk a little. At first they’d

even cuddle at night, but it was as if Y/N was slowly drifting apart.

    “I know you aren’t sleeping,” Harry said finally. He had his back rested on the headboard and eyes fixed at her back.

    ‘Well, I am trying to sleep,” she finally said.

    “It’s nine, babe. You never sleep this early.”

    Y/N didn’t reply this time. Harry almost thought it was the end of the conversation but then Y/N

stirred a little before sitting up and resting her back on the headboard just

like Harry.

     “Harry, I don’t think I can do this anymore,” she said slowly, still not looking at Harry.

    “Baby, why not?”

he took her hand in his. “I promise, I won’t ever do that again. She meant nothing. I love you, please we’ll make this

work.” Harry’s voice was soft but it was so desperate.

    “I just can’t,” Y/N took her hand away from him. “Every time I look at you I remember you’ve

been with her when I was waiting here for you. You cheated on me. It’s just not

fair.”

    She finally looked at him, reveling the watery eyes. Harry honestly didn’t know what to do.

But, he was scared, he was so fucking scared that she’d finally leave him.

    In one swift motion he threw his arms around her and pulled her as close as he could. He was scared.

    “I know, but please Y/N we can make this work, just- we can make this work,” he was crying then. “I love you and we

will get through this. I know I messed up but I promise it won’t happen ever

again.”

    Y/N didn’t say anything for a while, but Harry could hear the soft cries she was letting out.

    It broke his heart. He never wanted to be the reason of her tears but he knew, he hurt her

in one of the worst way possible.

    “Ple-“

    Before, Harry could start again, Y/N spoke. “Make love to me.”

    It took Harry a little by surprise. He let of go her a little and looked at her.

    “Make love to me,Harry,” she told him again.

    This time Harry didn’t waste any time and crashed his lips on hers. Their lips molded into each

other’s, and finally after so long Harry felt the burning passion they once

had. It was as strong as it used to be but it was definitely there and Harry

had never been this thankful.

    That night, they had taken it slow, but the passion and love they had, grew equally fast.

    “I love you,”

Harry had let out the moment he came. He was crying then and so was Y/N, but

for some reason this time he was happy. He didn’t know why but those tears- it just felt right.

    Harry kissed her one last time and rolled over on his side, but he didn’t pull himself out, it just

felt right.

    Y/N didn’t say anything though, but she was smiling through her tears. But, it wasn’t just the

smile that told him that everything will be alright, it was the feeling. It was

as if there was a bubble around them, keeping them away from all the wrongs in

the world, all the wrongs in the past. If Harry could, he’d stay like that

forever, with her so close and everything just right. He kissed her again, this

time Harry was smiling too. Harry didn’t know how long they stayed like that,

looking at each other and smiling bright while their eyes twinkled like the

very first time they met when they were in kindergarten. However, Y/N hadn’t yet

replied, there was no confirmation. But, it was as if she read his mind and

finally told him.

     “I love you too.”

blog.title: Here To Take My Medicine
blog.description: 🌈Marissa (she/her)🌈 Harry has my heart ~ My Writing ~ Follows back from @bibliosomniac

summary: ‘Perfect two - Autumn’ only because it’s a super cute song and I have faith in you ❤️
question: ‘Perfect two - Autumn’ only because it’s a super cute song and I have faith in you ❤️
answer:
I can’t believe I’ve never heard of this song and it has 82 million views on one YouTube video alone, lol. Sorry for the wait on this request, I hope you like it!! I wrote it based on the lyrics as opposed to the sound of the song – I imagine Harry performing this song in the story to be a similar change from the 1D WMYB to the version he performed on tour. Does that make sense? He would make it rock-y but would keep all the fun and joy in the original song. And of course he’d prance about while doing it. Enjoy!

Harry keeps his head down towards his shoes as he takes a deep breath, but you can see that he’s smiling. It’s the kind of smile that’s accompanied by dimples and a rosy blush high on his cheekbones. You’re surprised to notice that he looks a little nervous, even though he usually feels so at home on a stage. Maybe it’s because he knows every single person in the room. Or maybe it’s because you’re staring straight at him, waiting for him to deliver whatever surprise he’s been promising you for months.

You’re at the table closest to the stage, where Harry was sitting only a moment ago. Is it crazy to miss his presence already? He’s not even that far away and you already feel the absence of him engulf you. Perhaps you’re just overly emotional today.

Harry takes a few minutes to set up on the stage with his band Mitch, Claire and Sarah. Since travelling on tour with them for so long, they’re more than just a band – they’re like family now. Harry is particularly close with Mitch and you’ve become fairly close to Sarah and Claire too.

You’re so impatient for Harry to start that you lean over and have a short chat with Gemma to try and keep yourself distracted. Before you know it, the lights in the hall begin to dim and Harry shines in a spotlight. He takes his place in front of the microphone and you can tell that his nerves from before have fallen away. No matter how many times you see him perform, you’re always amazed by his confidence on stage. He truly transforms – it’s still him, but it’s a version of him that feels made for this.

You’d guessed it would be a song, and you were right. But will he sing a cover of your favourite song? Will he perform the ballad that played when he first kissed you in his Range Rover after your second date? Or did he write you a new song entirely?

“Hey everyone,” Harry smiles into the mic. His favourite white guitar hangs over his chest as if it’s always meant to be there. The audience cheers for him – it’s nowhere near the roar of his stadium tour crowds, but Harry’s never looked happier. He’s positively glowing.

When the song starts, Harry takes a step back from the mic and rolls his shoulders to the groove of the beat. It reminds you a little bit of his tour version of What Makes You Beautiful. You’re already beaming – you missed seeing him prance about on a stage like no one was watching.

And Harry missed nothing more than performing for you. He loves how it feels to sing in front of you, and see your face light up as if you’re the one in the spotlight instead of him. On tour, he always had to remind himself to perform for an entire crowd when you were there – because he only ever wanted to sing to you. But tonight, he is singing just for you. The song he wrote isn’t for anyone else. It’s all for you. He knows that what he ended up with is pretty cheesy, but he figures that he’s allowed to be as cheesy as he wants. No one will make fun of him for it like they usually might – it is his wedding day, after all.

You start to cry before the first verse is over. When he says you’re the one I wanna marry, you let out something between a cry and a laugh. Your guests are clapping along, but you only hear Harry. His voice is like liquid smoke, or like a warm hug from him when you’ve just come in from the cold. You never get used to his voice – your skin prickles with goosebumps every time you hear him sing.

We’re the perfect two, baby me and you, we’re the perfect two.

When the song ends, you jump out of your seat and climb onto the stage to embrace Harry. Your husband. You’re both giggling into the hug, and have never felt such joy. You kiss each other deeply, right in the spotlight, but neither of you care about the hollers from your guests and the nearby band. He’d sung everything you felt but couldn’t find the words to say. And you know with a bracing certainty that it’s entirely true – you really are the perfect two.

Send me a song and I’ll make it into a blurb!
answer_abstract:
I can’t believe I’ve never heard of this song and it has 82 million views on one YouTube video alone, lol. Sorry for the wait on this request, I hope you like it!! I wrote it based on the lyrics as opposed to the sound of the song – I imagine Harry performing this song in the story to be a similar change from the 1D WMYB to the version he performed on tour. Does that make sense? He would make it rock-y but would keep all the fun and joy in the original song. And of course he’d prance about while doing it. Enjoy!

Harry keeps his head down towards his shoes as he takes a deep breath, but you can see that he’s smiling. It’s the kind of smile that’s accompanied by dimples and a rosy blush high on his cheekbones. You’re surprised to notice that he looks a little nervous, even though he usually feels so at home on a stage. Maybe it’s because he knows every single person in the room. Or maybe it’s because you’re staring straight at him, waiting for him to deliver whatever surprise he’s been promising you for months.

You’re at the table closest to the stage, where Harry was sitting only a moment ago. Is it crazy to miss his presence already? He’s not even that far away and you already feel the absence of him engulf you. Perhaps you’re just overly emotional today.

Harry takes a few minutes to set up on the stage with his band Mitch, Claire and Sarah. Since travelling on tour with them for so long, they’re more than just a band – they’re like family now. Harry is particularly close with Mitch and you’ve become fairly close to Sarah and Claire too.

summary: Breakdown - A Series Of Parental Events
title: Breakdown - A Series Of Parental Events
body:
The journey to Uncle Max’s turns out to be more hassle than you’d hoped.

A/N: Hiii I’m so sorry I sat on this for so long. I’ve had a weird couple of weeks, but I am back and this is long overdue. I am not done with this series, I refuse to be because it’s so much fun to write. This part is 3k! Love always, Kate xxx

“Can I drive?” Aoife asks with an expectant grin.

You pause and look back to her with raised brows, Harry’s expression very similar to yours. Dillon is stood by the back door of the car with a bemused look on his face.

“Okay, two things baby girl,” you hover your hand on the passenger side door, “you haven’t passed your test yet back home, and you’re too young to drive in this country regardless.”

Dillon snorts and quickly slips into the back seat behind Harry. “Savage!”

Harry frowns at Dillon but keeps his attention on Fee. “Maybe next year, eh?” He sends her a little wink and a smile which seems to only make her more stroppy.

You throw an irritated glance Harry’s way. “Don’t say that!”

“Well she might be able to!” Harry retorts, throwing his hands up in defence. “Come on, I want to get going before we can’t get out of the city because it’s too busy.” He nods his head towards the car and opens his door.

Fee huffs and slides into the other backseat behind you, while you get settled into the front. “I still hate this journey.” You mutter under your breath.

Harry glances at you and smirks. “Are we… are we having a little whinge over there, eh?” He teases you with a giggle, poking your thigh as he turns the engine on.

You ignore him and fiddle around with the stereo on the dashboard. “What are we listening to this time, kiddies?” You ask, loud enough for the kids to hear in the back.

“Can it not be a One Direction marathon like we did last year?” Dillon grumbles.

“How rude…” You mumble, glancing at Harry who’s scowling over his shoulder.

“Oi, how many times have I told you that you wouldn’t be here if it weren’t for that band?”

You nudge for him to concentrate and frown a little. “What, so you think that if you were never in One Direction we’d never have met?” Your tone holds a hint of scepticism and offence, and you decide on something harmless that no one would complain about for the time being.

“Well done, Dad.” Dillon mutters from behind Harry, sharing a smirk with Fee.

“Probably not, no. Let’s face it.” Harry shrugs, seemingly confused by your new offended demeanour.

“Just remember kids, your dad told me when he proposed that he’d found his soulmate and we’d have found each other anywhere, because we were meant to be.” You angle yourself towards the middle of the car, but keep your hard gaze that matches your voice on your husband.

“That’s really cheesy.” Fee cackles behind you.

“Cheesy or not, he’s now admitted he made it up.” You huff, glaring at him until he speaks again.

“I didn’t make it up, I do think we’re soulmates.” He retorts with a crease between his brow. “And your mum loves it when I’m cheesy.”

“So how can we be soulmates if you don’t think we’d have found each other if you weren’t in One Direction? Bare in mind we met after One Direction broke up.” You asked flatly, keeping your gaze on him still.

Harry wishes he’d eaten his words as he awkwardly chews on his bottom lip. “I mean… do you really think we would have found each other?”

Your children erupt into fitting laughter as you continue to grow more irate. Harry further regrets what he’d said even more and wishes the ground would swallow him up, preferably not with the rest of the car.

“Dad mate, you’re digging yourself an even bigger hole.” Dillon cackles, reaching forward to smack his dad’s arm.

“So really, when you said we’d have found each other anywhere, you didn’t actually mean it at all, it was just you being poetic?” You challenge, your arms now folded across your chest. “Who helped you write that, eh? Mitch? Niall? You were pretty cosy with him again when you proposed, weren’t you?”

“I think you’re being a bit dramatic…” Harry lets out a long breath, still refusing to admit he was wrong.

“No, no, no.” You push for an answer, your voice raising in volume with each individual word. “I want to know which lyricist extraordinaire helped you write the words you used to propose to me with, so I know who needs a smack the next time I see them.”

“No one helped me, for crying out loud!” He yells suddenly, sending you a little glare without really taking his eyes off the road.

“So you just lied then?!” You shout back, though in a much higher and shrill pitch.

“Are you really gonna get pissy over something I said over twenty years ago?!” He asks incredulously, shifting angrily in his seat.

“I am when it was a fucking proclamation of your supposed love!” You all but screech, completely oblivious to the fact that you’ve just sworn in front of your children for the very first time.

Fee and Dillon know you’re not messing now, because they’ve seen you angry before and you’d still managed to keep a lid on your cursing. Harry on the other hand doesn’t seem too fazed.

“What the fuck do you mean, ‘supposed’?!” He scoffs bitterly. “We’ve been married twenty years, we have two children together and we still do it at every fucking opportunity! If I didn’t love you you’d bloody know about it!”

~

A phone call has interrupted your uncomfortable silence. For about half and hour you’ve all been sat in silence after your little spat with Harry, you glaring out the side window as Harry’s knuckles grow whiter over his crushing grip on the steering wheel. Fee and Dillon have been sharing glances and bemused smirks, but refusing to say anything in case one of you tells them to shut up. You never would, neither of you. In fact you wish they would speak so that the tension isn’t so obvious anymore.

It’s your phone that’s ringing, so you quickly answer it to stop the noise. “Hi Max.”

“Hello!” God he sounds more and more like your dad everyday. “Are you all en route?”

“Yeah, we’re um… just about to join the M4 by Heathrow.” You mumble.

“Lovely job. I assume you’ll drop your things at the flat first?”

You internally cringe and take a deep breath. “Er probably,” you reluctantly look to Harry, “are we going to the flat first?”

Harry glances to you with a surprised glint in his eye and nods slowly. “Yeah, just to drop everything off and freshen up.” He’s only surprised because he’s normally the one who has to extend the olive branch and go in with his tail between his legs, not the other way around.

You nod once and look back out the windshield. “Yeah we are. So we’ll probably be over around mid afternoon.”

“Alright, see you then!”

“See you later.” You hum, before putting the phone down and setting it back in your lap.

It’s quiet again for a moment, just the hum of the car and the whoosh of the other passing vehicles. You wonder if maybe you had been dramatic earlier, getting so wound up about something that deep down you probably know to be true. Hell, of course you were being dramatic, but it still got to you a little that Harry apparently felt that way. Maybe you were being unreasonable.

“Is Uncle Max having a barbecue again?” Fee interrupts your quiet with her soft question.

You crane your neck to limply smile at her around the head rest. “I don’t know, love. Probably. It’s a fairly warm day so there’s every possibility.”

“Maybe Auntie Lana’ll make that fancy potato salad you all loved so much.” Harry adds, much to pretty much everyone’s surprise.

Dillon’s groan came right from his chest. “Oh my God, that was good.”

“It was, wasn’t it?” Harry chuckles. “Not too much mayo, still got the skin on the potatoes,”

“And she put um, chicken and little bits of bacon in it too.” Fee gushes, the entire car giggling at the thought of it.

“Don’t get arsey if she didn’t make it though, just ask her for a recipe or something so we can take it home.” You remind them.

“Mum, it’s just a potato salad…” Dillon chuckles with a bemused frown.

“Yeah, well we all know if I try and make it you’ll all complain it’s not the same.” You grumble with a little roll of your eyes. You sound like your mother.

The car falls silent again, but seemingly more comfortably this time, regardless of your little bitter comment. It’s only a brief moment before you feel Harry’s hand reach across the middle partition to slip into yours, his fingers interlocking with yours, and you don’t hesitate to grip his hand back.

~

“Shit.” Harry mumbles under his breath, only loud enough for you to hear.

His hand, that had been clinging to yours for the past twenty minutes, finally freeing itself to start poking at things on the dashboard.

“What’s up?” You ask quietly, realising that he’s checking through the car’s readings.

“Need to pull over, something’s not right.” He sighs, switching from the fast lane to the outside lane in one smooth movement.

“Can you manage another mile?” You look up to him with a small frown. “Reading services is literally a minute away.”

“We don’t normally stop at that one, do we?” Dillon asks, apparently paying more attention than you’d expected him to.

“No, we usually stop at Leigh Delamere.” You confirm with a sort of half smile. “We’re a fair way off from there, I’m afraid.”

“Why are we stopping? I don’t like these services.” Fee grumbles with a slight frown.

You and Harry share a smirk and laugh between yourselves for a second. “Baby girl, you’ve never been to them, how do you know you don’t like them?” You challenge with stifled grin.

“I just know I won’t.” She grumbles with a shrug.

“We only stop at Leigh Delamere because you lot always want a KFC rather than a McDonald’s.” You remind her with a little giggle.

“A tradition that you started, love.” Harry nudges you.

You pause for a moment, glancing between your husband and your children before settling back into your seat. “Alright, fair’s fair I guess.”

Your little family snigger at your surrender, and you’re silently thankful that the atmosphere is a lot calmer than it was half an hour ago, and that Harry is seemingly managing to keep his cool with regards to his current car situation.

Harry pulls off into the services, parking the car in a far corner of the large car park under some trees to avoid any suspecting onlookers, a habit he’d adopted way before he even met you. He used to claim it was to keep the sun off it, but in a cold winter that’s a fairly poor excuse.

“What’s wrong with it?” You ask as he pulls the leaver by his feet to release the bonnet.

“I’m not sure. I think it’s the oil, but I might be wrong.” He mumbles as he climbs out.

You follow behind him, the kids clambering out but keeping out of the way as the two of you asses the state of his car. You want to say it’s probably to do with the fact it’s been left so long without being driven, especially since Gemma normally takes it for a drive every so often while she can but maybe hasn’t had a chance to recently, but for the sake of avoiding another argument you keep quiet.

It doesn’t take Harry long to decide that he should probably call someone out to have a look, so as he rings the AA you take your family to get something to eat. Twenty minutes later the breakdown recovery man shows up, and Harry takes Dillon along with him while you and Fee stay put to wander the few shops.

“Mum, can I get this?” Fee interrupts your book browsing to wiggle a cheap looking plush toy in your face.

Your brows raise like a natural instinct. “Er, what on Earth for?”

“For my beanie baby collection.” She answers as if your question were dumb.

“But… it’s not… it’s not a beanie baby, Fee.” The beanie baby collection she had was actually yours, and there was no way in hell she’d be getting a shit toy to add to an otherwise pristine collection.

“Well… can I get it anyway?”

“No, Fee. Put it back.” You realise now that you sound like your own mother, but you ignore that thought, mentally shoving it all the way to the back of your mind and locking it up. You refuse to believe you’re anything like your mother.

“Boo,” She scoffs, shoving the toy back into the cage she’d pulled it from with a scowl, grandma would’ve let me have it.”

And no, she’s not talking about Anne, she’s talking about your mother. “Yeah well, Grandma’s not here.”

“Will she be there later?”

“Not if your Uncle Max has got anything to do with it.” You remind her, since your brother has less of a relationship with your mum than you do, and they live twenty minutes away from each other.

~

“Mum, look at this.” Fee giggles as she shows you her phone.

It’s been an hour since Harry and Dillon went to meet the recovery bloke, and they’re still with him. Both you and Fee are growing restless and irate, now sitting in a coffee shop on your second round of coffees.

You watch Fee’s phone as she plays a video of Dillon from just a moment ago, half his frame on one side whilst in the background Harry stresses watching the breakdown man fiddle with his car. You shouldn’t laugh, but Dillon quietly singing the words to Daughtry’s Breakdown over the top of their talking makes it hard not to howl. You’re not sure if Harry’s noticed, but if he has he’s going a fantastic job of ignoring him.

“Who’s he sent that to?” You ask worriedly, still struggling to contain your smirk.

Fee shrugs with a mirrored expression. “Dunno, probably everyone.”

You cringe lightly, but you’re still unable to stop your laughter. “Come on, lets get something for the drive and go.”

~

Once you’re back outside the breakdown man is just pulling off. You watch him drive away and then look to Harry with an expectant expression.

“All sorted?”

He rolls his eyes and nods lightly. “Yeah, finally. Still have no idea what the actual problem was. Seems like he didn’t either.”

“Oh well,” you stroke his arm as he leans in to kiss your cheek, “sorted now. We got you water and a coffee, weren’t sure which one you’d want.”

Harry beams at you and takes the bottle and coffee from your hands. “Both at the moment.”

You giggle and hurry back around to the passenger side as the rest of your family climb back into the car. Within moments you’re back on the motorway while Dillon takes the lead with the music, and once again you’re cackling when he plays Breakdown first through the car speakers.

~Series Masterlist~

Gracias muchachas(?)!

body_abstract:
The journey to Uncle Max’s turns out to be more hassle than you’d hoped.

A/N: Hiii I’m so sorry I sat on this for so long. I’ve had a weird couple of weeks, but I am back and this is long overdue. I am not done with this series, I refuse to be because it’s so much fun to write. This part is 3k! Love always, Kate xxx

“Can I drive?” Aoife asks with an expectant grin.

You pause and look back to her with raised brows, Harry’s expression very similar to yours. Dillon is stood by the back door of the car with a bemused look on his face.

“Okay, two things baby girl,” you hover your hand on the passenger side door, “you haven’t passed your test yet back home, and you’re too young to drive in this country regardless.”
